Representation.origin: [the contract of sale contains a by the purchaser " U.S. Code "]

sub_terms.a: a statement or account made to influence opinion or action compare
sub_terms.b: an incidental or collateral statement of fact on the faith of which a contract is entered into [the contract of sale contains a by the purchaser ""]a statement of fact made by an applicant to an insurer for the purpose of obtaining insurance

2.definition: the act or action of representing

sub_terms.a: the action or fact of one person standing for another so as to have the rights and obligations of the person represented
sub_terms.b: the substitution of an individual or class in place of a person (as when a child or children take the share of an estate that would have fallen to a deceased parent) see also
sub_terms.c: the action of representing or the fact of being represented esp. in a legislative body
sub_terms.d: the act or action by a lawyer of providing legal advice to a client and appearing (as in court) to speak and act on the client's behalf

3.definition: the body of persons representing a constituency
